ImportLOF.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /**********************************************************************
00002 
00003   Audacity: A Digital Audio Editor
00004 
00005   ImportLOF.h
00006 
00007   David I. Murray
00008 
00009   Supports the opening of ".lof" files which are text files that contain
00010   a list of individual files to open in audacity in specific formats.
00011 
00012   (In BNF) The syntax for an LOF file, denoted by <lof>:
00013 
00014   <lof> ::= [<window> | <file> | <#>]*
00015   <window> ::= window [<window-parameter>]* <newline>
00016   <window-parameter> ::= offset <time> | duration <time>
00017   <time> ::= [<digit>]+ [ . [<digit>]* ]
00018   <file> ::= file [<file-parameter>]* <newline>
00019   <file-parameter> ::= offset <time>
00020   <#> ::= <comment> <newline>
00021 
00022   EXAMPLE LOF file:
00023 
00024   # everything following the hash character is ignored
00025   window # an initial window command is implicit and optional
00026   file "C:\folder1\sample1.wav"    # sample1.wav is displayed
00027   file "C:\sample2.wav" offset 5   # sample2 is displayed with a 5s offset
00028   File "C:\sample3.wav"            # sample3 is displayed with no offset
00029   window offset 5 duration 10      # open a new window, zoom to display 
00030   # 10 seconds total starting at 5 (ending at 15) seconds
00031   file "C:\sample3.wav" offset 2.5
00032 
00033   SEMANTICS:
00034 
00035   There are two commands: "window" creates a new window, and "file"
00036   appends a track to the current window and displays the file there. The
00037   first file is always placed in a new window, whether or not an initial
00038   "window" command is given.
00039 
00040   Commands have optional keyword parameters that may be listed in any
00041   order. A parameter should only occur once per command. The "offset"
00042   parameter specifies a time offset. For windows, this is the leftmost
00043   time displayed in the window. For files, the offset is an amount by
00044   which the file is shifted in time before display (only enabled for audio;
00045   not midi). The offset is specified as an integer or decimal number of
00046   seconds, and the default value is zero.
00047 
00048   Windows may also have a "duration" parameter, which specifies how much
00049   time should be displayed in the window. The default duration is equal
00050   to the duration of the longest track currently displayed.
00051 
00052 **********************************************************************/
00053

00055 #define __AUDACITY_IMPORT_LOF__

00061                         UnusableImportPluginList *unusableImportPluginList);
